page.title: 18YOUTH AND LEISURE.
page.content: Leisure facilities are scarce for youngsters in the area apart from tennis courts and facilities in parks and private clubs, such as{cricket. The bowling green is, of course, used by the elderly and the nearest leisure centre is in Altrincham. There used to be a cinema in Hale but this was demolished only to be replaced by privately owned flats. The annual{Rose {Queen Festival,}in June, attracts many groups, such as the scouts, guides, bands and morris dancers but on the whole children have either to travel to Altrincham or save their money. There are three primary schools in the area but many eleven year olds interviewed seem to rely heavily upon their parents for transport, especially after school. On the whole many children seem isolated and{bored and need direction in their leisure.
